info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 31 at 12:01PM PST until February 02 at 10:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM PST /8 AM MST/ TO 10 PM PST /11 PM MST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...North winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. 1 to 3 foot waves for area lakes possible. * WHERE...In Arizona, Lake Havasu, Fort Mohave and the Lake Mead National Recreation Area. In California, San Bernardino County- Upper Colorado River Valley. In Nevada, Laughlin and the Lake Mead National Recreation Area. * WHEN...From 7 AM PST /8 AM MST/ to 10 PM PST /11 PM MST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Strong wind gusts could lead to damage to some trees and power lines resulting in power outages. Wind gusts and high wave action on area lakes resulting in hazardous boating conditions. Areas of blowing dust may also result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds are expected to peak during the afternoon on Wednesday, but strong winds gusts could begin as early as sunrise for parts of the Colorado River Valley and could linger after sunset. If the forecast continues to trend higher, an upgrade to a High Wind Warning may be needed.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
